several times i have visited this location, and i have encountered...messed up orders, the drive thru order takers are not very friendly, and at times the order takers inside do not pay attention to customers standing right in front of their counters until, the manager says something!honestly, this particular location can be a hit-or-miss! one day you will get excellent customer service, the next day not so much!
slowest mcdonalds ever....especially in the morn
mixed up order: forgot fries. ξcrispy chicken instead of grilled. ξput mayo in sandwich when asked for it on the side.cash only for drive through but accepted credit when dining in...

i never believed it until now,.. ξ"they screw you at the drive thru"... ξyep. check your bag before you leave the window because they have a tendency more often than not to not give you what you ordered.case in point: ξtoday at 5:45am, picking up breakfast for the family. ξpurchased 4 hash browns, 2 sausage burritos, 1 parfait, 2 large sweet teas and a hotcakes and sausage with extra butter (and i asked for the extra butter repeatedly). ξwe waited the drive thru for a good 5 minutes because they were making our hash browns "fresh", so they said. ξi get home, and there is no parfait. ξergh!!! ξcalled the restaurant and it seems like them screwing up at the drive thru is common place. ξshe took my name down and asked if i wanted to come back this morning, or if she should add my name to the book. ξnow that one of my kids did not have their breakfast item, i continued to go through the bags to find out that there is no extra butter, and they did not include the picante sauce packets for the burritos. ξhow hard is it for your employees to double check the bags before you give it to the customer? ξi mean, you have the receipt that tells you exactly what to put in the bags. ξthis is the closest mc donald is to our home, and it will soon be put on my banned restaurant list.
you eat this food at your own risk!!
awful service and extremely slow. go elsewhere.

honestly mcdonalds is a mcdonalds but i have never been to one so slow. went in to grab some breakfast and, although no one was there, it still took 20 min. the fact that i keep coming back is just because it is close.

not sure why this mcdonald is is showing as closed. it is connected to the terrible is gas station and still in business. they have a 24 hour drive-thru as well.i have never been inside, only ordered at the drive-thru. the employees are pretty friendly, they have fast service, and no problems with my orders so far. ξi love the $1 large sweet teas!!i moved to the area a few weeks ago and have driven by here before, but could not remember if i saw a sign saying that they had a 24 hour drive-thru. so the first time i came here, i asked the cashier at the first window:me: is your drive-thru 24 hours?employee: ummm...... i think so? but i am not sure. do you want me to ask? me: that is okay, i will ask at the next window.lol he works there and did not know what their drive-thru hours were?!?! come on!! well, as i drove up to the second window to get my food, i saw the 24 hour sign. but still, as an employee, you should at least know what the restaurant is hours are right??

this mcdonalds' gets 3 stars for being open all night. sometimes i just have a craving for chicknuggets or i just need to grab some double cheeseburgers at 3am and maxwell st depot polish is not what i am craving. so kudos for being the closest open 24 hour mcds to me.however, if you do come, take notice of the giant cpd hq building that is just a few blocks west of this place. if anything was to go down, hurry to this refuge of safety.this following rant is not on this specific location but on mcds in general. what the hell is a friggin' mcdouble and why is it replacing the double cheeseburger for 99c? a mcdouble is a fancy way of saying "we jacked yo cheeze, foo!" it is a double cheeseburger with only 1 slice of cheese. 1 tiny slice of cheese is not enough to satisfy my cheeseburger craving!!!! i guess i am too poor to be more than a dolla menunaire cuz i can no longer afford a double cheeseburger at $1.29 and i can only get the 99c mcdouble.

service is terribly slow. orders have never been correct. manager oscar is trained in a third world country. i have boycotted this location for the last year and i live and work within walking distance of this place. i would much rather go out of my way and give my money to the boca park location.

worst service and food i have ever experienced at mcdonald is l have ever been to.completely wrong order. ignored at counter when trying to get corrected and even then wrong order and yet again ignored. you would think they would be sensitive on the third time retuning to get a complete order. but no. and then ignored the fourth time when asking to get access to the bathroom.

i stopped at this location with my boyfriend earlier this evening to grab a bite to eat after stopping off to pick up some things for his apartment and this was one of the most ghetto mcd is i have been to. i have seen some pretty bad places, but this place took the cake in terms of filth and vagrancy because the place seemed to be a location for people to loiter around in and having people up in there begging for change and all while you are trying to order your food. i was waiting with my fiance for his food to come up and the guy behind the counter was banging his hand saying "can i help the next customer".....really you think you can get someone is attention banging your hand on the counter like some ignorant fool with no professional standards. who would want to eat in this place with folks standing outside trying to sell you stuff and this one guy was begging for change to allegedly feed his baby sister.....that is so typical for them to sit there and lie because they want someone to give them money so they can feed their whatever habit they are trying to hide. this restaurant is situated in one of the most ghetto neighborhoods on the west side which says how the standards has gone down. if they really cared they would keep the restaurant clean inside and outside and i was glad that i did not see the inside of the bathroom because if it is a ghetto mcdonalds the bathrooms wouldnt exactly look like they were maintained well either. i wouldnt bother eating here unless you want to be harassed by goofy hoodrats and crack fiends looking for someone to give them change. i can think of at least 10 mcdonalds locations that has staff that do not look like they were plucked from the ghetto garden because this mcdonalds seems to employ hoodrats and ghetto snots to work at this particular location. i have gotten much better service elsewhere than this place i will not be coming here again and i want to be served by someone who can properly wear a hairnet that is not the length of the hairstyle and doesnt look like a hoodrat with multi colored dragon lady tips a mile long.

this is a large, relatively modern-looking mcds. its a bit grimy, which in mho, kind of defeats the purpose of the remodel. why bother making it all pretty & modern if youre not going to wipe it down regularly?the service here is ok. food is standard mcds fare. the one reason we come here is for the huge four-story play area. the kids enjoy exploring it, and i enjoy getting a half hour of sanity. ξtheres a small space underneath for littler guys to play in, but this playplace is realistically more for older kids who can climb well. the kids room is completely closed off from the rest of the restaurant, which works great at keeping my boys from running off, and theres a separate bathroom in here just for aparents. ξno changing table, which for some strange reason seems to be the way las vegas restaurants roll. i really hate that. therefore they shouldnt be surprised when i change a poopy diaper on one of their posh bench seats since theres nowhere else to do it.maybe then they will wipe it down afterwards... but dont count on it.

of course this is a fast food restaurant so of course there is not much of a spectacular review that i can write but i will express my concerns. i work late nights and when i do get off work if there nothing ready in the house i will stop and my only option is mcdonalds or checkers. needless to say this is nothing short of "ghetto". i could hear the employees in the background laughing and playing over the intercom as i am ordering the food. after i ordered, she did not even bother to tell me my total or go over my order with me. ξwhen i made it to the window she was having a conversation with her co worker despite me having my hand out the window to give her the money. when i drove up to the second window....someone had been smoking a cigarette and threw it right outside the drive-through window. now i do not know if it was maybe a previous customer or and employee but nobody was in front of me when i pulled up but hard to say. i could hear the music they were playing over my radio in the car and to top it off. somebody was calling another chick a "b*tch" and just being loud. i mean hey, did not expect nothing spectacular but if these are the people thats making my big mac, i will pass. the day shift is the complete opposite so do not be discouraged too much by this. my food tasted mcdonalds worthy but they need to change up that scenery a bit.

of all the mcdonald is restaurants in america, i believe this is the worst.the parking lot is cramped and begging for a low-speed crash.on a saturday afternoon, my friends and i were told no carbonated beverages were available. no coke with my mcnuggets? criminal.the bathroom doors are locked and require an attendant to unlock them, which suggests to me few people have washed their hands before eating. and with the length of lines here, who would go to the trouble of getting the bathroom opened up?and charging for extra condiments? wtf?

i bought a filet-o-fish and asked for a large cup of ice. they charged me $1 for a cup of ice...fail!

the stingiest mcdonalds i have ever been to... including downtown!!!service: 4 -they were nice and spoke english. great! ξ-saw someone get a chocolate covered sundae... only the darn thing was not even *covered*, as if they took an airbrush system and lightly sprayed a translucent film over. tsk tsk price: 3-they charge you for plastic bags, ketchup packers and god knows what else. i would not be surprised if they charged me for napkins to-go.- gasped when i was told would be an extra 25 cents to get ketchup packets (a whole ketchup bottle would not even cost you anymore than $2). atmosphere: 4.5- went late afternoon, pretty empty; not loud, not dirty.food: 2/5- did not think i would have to rate my food, until i came home and found that my fries were cold and stale as well as my nuggets. ugh. - irony is their employees understood english, but for the very first time in my life, they messed up my order. i said 1 ranch 1 barbecue... instead 2 ranch sauce inside.

food is good but staff/service is horrendous. every single time i go there they mess up my order, in my opinion they need to hire all new staff. and when i complained, i got attitude from the manager. worst mcdonald is.

i can not do zero stars so this place gets 1 star. ξthey nickel and dime you for sauces and add-ons here and, in spite of the fact that there is a neon sign that says "drive through open 24 hours" they are only open until 11pm. really???? 24 hour sign glowing and you close at 11pm?????

i can not do zero stars so this place gets 1 star. ξthey nickel and dime you for sauces and add-ons here and, in spite of the fact that there is a neon sign that says "drive through open 24 hours" they are only open until 11pm. really???? 24 hour sign glowing and you close at 11pm?????

this used to be one of the very best mcdonalds anywhere, then the ownership changed apparently to corporate and the location has not been the same since. service is often hap hazard and the employees , i guarantee, will talk and talk and let you wait at the counter. the interior of this mcdonalds is one of those unique ones done up in black and white and while it is beginning to reflect it is age, when the place is clean still looks good. busy drive through as this is on a ξmain plano street.

despite this being the closest mcdonalds to my place, it is not the one i frequent most often. ξi have found the lines, both the drive through and inside, tend to be very long. ξusually i go down the street to the milwaukee/western mcdonalds as there is rarely a line, and if there is, it moves quickly. ξi have had no problem with the food at this location, just a preference for fast service.

worst! mcdonalds! ever! ξi am not a huge fan of mickey d is, but when your driving cross country there is nothing better than a md is cheeseburger. ξthere is no crap falling out all over the place; it is one concise package. ξthat being said, this was awful. ξi was hungry late in the day yesterday and thought i would walk next door to my neighborhood mickey d is. ξnormally i have a hamburger and cheeseburger, no fries no drink, but today i had the asian salad, with grilled chicken. ξthe chicken had this slimy goup all over it. ξit made the chicken inedible as well as the salad beneath it. ξ my friend had a six piece chicken nugget and a fish fillet. ξboth were horrible. ξmy friend is a connoisseur of md is fish fillet sandwich and he found it intolerable. ξthe nuggets were devoid of their normal processed flavor which in this case is a bad thing. ξoverall, a horrible experience and i will never go back to this one.

status upon arrival: hungover, starving, filthy, 3 hours of sleep.even though mcdonalds is known to be fast food as in fast service, we love to request our angus burgers fresh upon order. (waiting the extra 10 minutes) okay, so we starved more than we had to, but finally after receiving our food, the first thing my cousin noticed was how old the patties were. little did they know my cousin worked at mcd is for over two years.if your going to give us crap anyways, give a lame excuse instead of having your customers starve for no reason. this branch definitely failed to meet our hunger satisfaction.

worst drove thru ever. ξi was car #7 sitting in a dual drive thru for 8 minutes and not 1 car had moved. i park and go inside. the manager waits on me and i said that the drive thru has not moved. she says, " yeah our drive thru system has gone done". i said " it would be nice if someone would walk out there and tell everyone and post a sign". she walks away to fill my order, only to leave one of her long bleached hairs in between my 2 frozen strawberry lemonades.

i travel quite a bit for the job, and i hate to admit it, but i eat at mcdonalds pretty frequently. ξthe healthy selections are actually pretty tasty and i love quarter pounders, just hold the cheese.mcdonalds are generally consistent. ξi find most of them are clean and professionally run. ξ this one is an exception. ξi stopped here for a mcmuffin and coffee before my flight. ξi had a 10:00 am flight, well past the morning rush. ξthe cooking areas of the restaurant were still dirty and the service was terrible. ξthey had a radio blaring some type of music and personal bags were hanging near the food prep areas. ξthe four people working were having trouble handling the two people in line. ξan employee in uniform (off-duty i guess) actually cut in front of me when i was in line to get her meal. ξ i complained, but it was the "manager" who handed her the meal. ξunreal. ξi sent a very long email to mcdonalds. ξyou naturally set the bar lower for fast food restaurants, but this mcdonalds managed to limbo under with plenty of room to spare. 1 star because the mcmuffin was ok.

i have to strike this fast food venue from my normal few lunch spots for awhile. ξthe last two visits have been a disappointment. ξmy french fries were cold both times. ξi ordered a premium chicken wrap with crispy chicken last week and received grilled chicken. ξthe receipt had it right so it was the line cooks who got it wrong. ξtoday i ordered chicken mcnuggets as a combo. ξagain and as i said before, cold fries. ξand i can guarantee the mcnuggets were not fresh. ξi got my food before i even got my change. ξit had all been sitting there well before i ordered. ξbesides the food, service was terrible. ξthere was one lady taking orders and she was even making some of the food. ξit made for some very slow service during a very busy lunch hour. ξrather than calling out an order or order number when ready, she looked at my boss and said "this is yours." ξhow rude! ξthere was a gentelman waiting for his food since before i walked in and was still waiting after i got mine. ξhis wife took her sandwich back and said it was not fresh. ξshe got a dirty look from the same rude cashier. ξi miss the days of the old manager whom i have not seen in a few months. ξhe had the staff on their game.

always busy, food usually cold. sigh.

they made me wait an extra 20 minutes just so they can throw my order at me. did not even ask if i need napkins or condiments. i called the store and did not even apologize, they gave me the wrong number to corporate, and then they hung up on me. i googled corporate is number, the i called corporate, and they gave me a voucher for 2 free meals.

this mcdonald is has pretty poor customer service and no organization. they let people cut in line, and knowing that they cut in, they serve them. that is the morning crew. the night crew works slower than slow. they have no regard for customers, or sense of urgency. i had to wait about 10 minutes for two frozen lemonades, and then another employee tried to take one of my lemonades away for another customer that had just ordered. the customers, as i mentioned, make it even worse. a big portion of the crowd that gathers at this mcd are scum. they are loud, obnoxious and unaware of their surroundings. if you want the worst experience at a mcd, then eat inside the restaurant. if you are in the area and in need of food or running late for class, then stop and get something to go. why do i keep coming back? $1 dollar coffee and .49c burgers (wednesdays)

there is one reason and one reason alone that my family comes to this mcdonald is - and it is the playplace. with nv is awful winter wind and scorching summers, it is a nightmare place for kids that need to run off some steam. we come here with my 5 year old sister and 8 year old brother so they can run around and to grab a drink. usually, this location is packed with kids. this mcdonald is is more expensive than other ones.

i have gone to this mcdonald is several times and they have gotten my order completely wrong. i go there before work around 7:30 so i am very hungry and i order a bacon egg and cheese biscuit... once i get to work i find what is in my bag is actually an egg mcmuffin...i absolutely hate those..so of course it is too late for me to drive back and get my correct order. i dont expect this to happen and its a elveru bisy mcdonalds so i dont stop at the srive thru to check my bag.i would just like to say,if this happened once in a blue moon,that is fine. mistakes happen..but not this many times. over it. i also notice that while i am giving my order at the drive thru,the person taking it is either never paying attention or rude. i wish this would change.. this mcdonald is seems to be constantly packed with people in the morning because its on a very high traffic road so they need to reevaluate their customer service.

fast food typically just is what it is, but this particular mcdonald is was awful.the service was terrible, ξthe cashier had an attitude not only with me but pretty much every customer that came through her line in the 15 minutes i waited to get my food (basic big mac & fries, nothing special). she forgot to give me my drink and when i asked her for it she tried to give me the size below what i ordered. when i asked for the right size she practically insisted i take the smaller one. then when my order was up and i asked for ketchup, she rolled her eyes and acted like i was making her go so far out of her way to reach under the counter. then, when i went to the fountain to get my drink, there were small bugs flying all around it.best part was when i got back and ate my food and realized that my fries were cooked in the same fryer the do the fish in. pretty sure those are supposed to be separate. threw those out, so ended up not needing the ketchup anyways. definitely do yourself a favor and go to a different location.

service here is way below average, even for a mcdonald is, the bar set is not high to begin with. enough said.

normally i do not review a chain unless something about that particular location stands out, good or bad.this location for some reason, has the most ridiculous service i have ever encountered. ξit is mcdonalds you say, what do you expect? ξnot much, really but let me tell you...encounter #1i ordered 10-piece chicken nuggets, fries, and unsweetened ice tea. ξi got the nuggets and tea. ξi went up to the counter, placed my receipt on the counter gently faced away from me, and said "i am sorry, i --" ξbefore i finished my sentence, the employee slammed her hand on my receipt on the counter and dragged it towards her. ξum... wtf?!i did not know how to react because she looked at my receipt and threw it away without addressing me. ξi went "um...ok..." and backed away from the counter to fill my tea. ξi have no clue what i did to piss this employee off but my friend who came with me, asked me what the heck happened. ξi said "i have no clue, i am just missing my fries..." ξmy friend was nice and *itchy enough to go up to the counter, grab the attention of a different employee and told him we were missing our fries.but honestly, what is wrong with you? ξi am sorry you were having a bad day but that does not excuse you from taking it out on a customer who was trying to be nice about an honest mistake that can be easily fixed. ξnot a big deal, i paid for fries and i have an incomplete order. ξso chill, geez.---------encounter #23 friends and i came here for smoothies. ξone of my friends ordered a big mac, nuggets and fries. ξeveryone else got our orders. ξmy friend waited 20 minutes for his order to be done. ξno lie, we looked at the time on the receipt.you are thinking, um yea maybe they were cooking it. ξno...in that 20 minutes, we saw 5 employees goofing off, bickering with each other, throwing towels at each other, and basically... being extremely unprofessional. ξthey did not even do this in the back were customers cant see, they did this all in front of us, just on the other side of the counter. ξbased on the manager is asking where the order is, they seem to have forgotten about the order.i do not care if you do this at work, but can you do this when no one is waiting for their food? ξit is really awkward to be standing and waiting while watching you goof off and have your manager ask the team where our order is... three times.i really felt embarrassed for the manager because this just reflects badly on him but he really should be more assertive and keep his team in check. ξfor his credit, he did give us a coupon for a free dessert of our choice...which honestly is nothing because i dont ever order a pie, cone, or sundae.oh and our smoothies were not filled all the way to the top... ξmine was 75% full.

this place is terrible. we went through the drive thru and ordered a value meal and a wrap. ξthey gave us the drink and the bag, which we assumed contained everything. ξwhen we got home, we found both the wrap and the receipt missing. ξmy boyfriend returned, fuming, and when he asked for the missing wrap, he was denied because he did not have the receipt! ξthe receipt they never gave us! he had to buy a new wrap. ξwe are never returning here again.

this mcdonalds is sloppy. it is fast food, but i do not get my food quick. every time i walk in i do not want to order, because the line is a mess and it seems far to long to wait. they take your order and move you to the right hand side to pick up your order. it was hard to pick up my order because it was that much people standing at the counter. plus this mcdonald is small, there was no real spot to line up to place your order. worst one i have eve been too! i was number 205 and i waited for ever and ever, and the manager was giving out the food and saw me standing there forever and she did not ask me what my order was or anything. it got up to 216 when the cashier had to ask me what my order was. so slow and disorganized and barely any space to eat and sit down.
they seem to be pretty quick most of the time, but their fries are always overcooked.

the only thing i am going to write about it is the location itself and the service. ξthis location is great if you work nearby (so you dont have to park behind the building), and there is a lot of seating. however, it is always crowded, and some of the people who are there seem a little suspect. ξthe workers quite efficient; i imagine that with the sort of crowds they get, they are pretty fast at getting your food out pretty quickly. just order, and they will take your name down and then you will get your food within 5 minutes. ξdue to the myriad type of characters that are inside, i tend to just pick up my food and head back to eat in my office.

i do not go to fast food joints often, but the people around me do.this place is the absolute worst, they treat every customer like crap.i do not expect much with food when its from a fast food chain, but this place serves cold food. i picked up a fish sandwich for my mother, what i got was a sandwich that was not even close to being warm. i once bought a ice cream for my nephew, seeing how he will probably make a mess i asked for a napkin only to be rejected. i can not even have a napkin for my little nephew is ice cream?i do not want to further elaborate on how bad the service is, the staff here gives all the customers an attitude. and the decor on the outside, a temple? really? because its chinatown?? do they design mcdonalds to look like mosques? churches? or whatever ethnic structure? this place is a lousy and disgusting eyesore, nuff said. if you want some mcds in the local area, go to the one on canal st. its a longer walk, but at least they do not treat like crap. sadly the lowest i can ever grant a review is 1 star, if i could they would get 1/4 of a star.

if you really need to go to mcdonald is, you should try this one. ξthey do not have wifi here, but there is a chandelier in the middle of the dining room, which has wood trim everywhere and framed fake paintings on the wall. ξit has a very classy feel to the place and i would hang out here, if only my friends would not just refuse the thought.also, the mccafe drinks are quite good, but they are still quite expensive. ξif you want a cheap espresso you should go to the lobby of the richardson library. ξcappuccinos, mochas, etc are just 75 cents a cup.

their brekky burritos are the best!! and, yes, this micky d is can have long lines in the morning, but that is b/c folks luv a good mcdonald is breakfast. and, you can not beat the prices! i mean, come on... ξthe deli across the food court tried to sell me a dannon yogurt for $4. wtf? at least mickey d is does not rape its customers by charging outrageous prices for something you can buy at any supermarket for under $2... well, maybe it rapes our arteries a bit, but if you practice moderation, you should be just fine.

recommend driving through and rather quickly at the risk of being assaulted or mobbed or groped or harassed.in the interest of full disclosure, though, i have been known to make an appearance or two here on a late, late night -- being propelled to find comfort in the arms of a greasy french fry. the egg mcmuffins sans canadian bacon and coffee combo makes my growing buddha belly happy. the other ordinary artery clogging goodness is just that. you get what you pay for...except here, you might not want to risk your safety by going into the store.

i am so relieved i am not the only one who knows how dysfunctional this mcdonalds is compared to any other. ξevery time i would be in the drive-thru they would get my order wrong, and as i waited for my upcoming wrong order with cars in front of me, i entertained myself by (1) watching ξthe hand-off of food from the employee ξto the driver of the car; (2) a slight pause; and (3) ξthen the hand back as the driver qa is and returns the wrong order that was given to them. ξi hope this mcdonald is improves because i am sure there are some good employees who work here and this is such a great location for this restaurant.

this place lack of integrity.i purchased some breakfast (muffins and coffee) for my office staff. ξthey charged me very high prices. ξi was in a rush and did not have time to argue.the next day, at the same time, i purchased the same thing in a different mcdonald for our chicago office staff, the bill is $10+ less.i do not have the time to go back to this mcdonald to argue. ξi just need to tell everyone do not go to this place. ξthe people there charge crazy prices and was not appear to be honest.

this place is a hot mess !! disgusting !! the girl taking out order was scratching her cooter the whole time she was talking to us, she could not understand our coffee order to save her life and after telling her six times i want  isweet chili sauce' for my chicken she finally tells us they do not have any and last but not least the fries were soggy and cold and the nuggets where refrigerator cold !! i will never come here ever again !!

i apologize ahead of time to the owners for giving bad publicity to this mcdonald is but over the few times i have visited this location, i have not had one good experience. 3 points for the double k to consider:1. if a customer asks for a refund after waiting over 25 minutes for a 4 piece nugget meal for their kid, your managers should show some sort of logic when dealing with upset people; maybe asking for the reason why a refund is being requested; maybe even go so far as to motivate the employees to not spend the majority of their shift texting on their phones.2. if your staff cannot handle the business from the counter and the drive through at the same time, maybe not such a good idea to add another drive through lane; another way to slam the staff with orders they cannot fill within a reasonable time!3. in the process of remodeling any of your locations and there is no regular restaurant seating, a suggestion to accommodate your customers during this temporary situation would be to keep the play place seating open until close so customers have a place to eat in.there are many more i could give but here are just a few suggestions from 3 separate visits in hopes the reason for this kind of service is due to you guys not knowing what goes on in this restaurant.

worst mcdonald is i have ever been to. slow and incompetent staff! i have been to this mcdonald is 3 times since it is right by my house and each time was a very bad experience. this can not be a coincidence where every experience was poor. i went inside to order and each time took 10 to 20 minutes to get my order. 2 out of the 3 times other customers complained because the staff forgot something where they had the wrong order, missing items or also waited more than 10 minutes. i can imagine that these kind of errors would happen if the restaurant was extremely busy but by looking at the people inside and the drive thru outside...the place was not busy so do they give poor service every time i go there? the last time i told the manager that i have been waiting over 10 minutes for 2 cheeseburgers fries and a coke so why does it take over 10 minutes to get my order? she threw my fries back and gave me new ones and then i waited another 5 minutes to get the cheeseburgers. bad place. do not go unless you have the patience to wait or want to receive or miss the wrong things in your orders.

i kinda wish there were negative stars. this mcdonald is charged my card the wrong amount. and did not tell me anything until i looked at my account and went back, they said my money will be returned to my account within hours. now 3 days later my money is still not in my account. also. i have been to other mcdonald is with long drive thru lines but they are moving at an okay pace. this mcdonald is drive thru lines are the slowest i have been in.

what a joke.do not do take out as you will not get anything that you ordered. we prefers and paid for items only to get home with 50% of the order accurate. i have been there numerous times and sadly the same thing happens. it is my fault because i should learn.does anyone know the owner?i can not believe that he would like this comment. woodstock macdonalds is not the place that ray crock invented. save yourself the frustration and waste if money, do not go there!i have learned now.

in an area as busy and affluent as solon, it was a shocking surprise to learn that it is home to one of the only mickey d is in existence without a drive-thru. in another not-so-shocking-twist, it is also home to even more horrendous slow, unfriendly fast food service that we have grown to love as east siders.
this does not deserve 1 star. wow! ξ fire the entire staff (including management ) ξand start over. ξso sad.

i only come to this location when i go to nellis afb and it is never that great. customer service needs some help, two polite employees does not make up for ten rude ones unfortunately. it is a nightmare going inside and the time it is dirty. i prefer the drive-thru but i can sit there for ever saying hello and no one responds or i will get a response to wait, not a please at all!!! that makes me kinda angry. i know some would not care but i have worked customer service before and it is not polite when you add a rude tone and attitude on top!!!i do not make it to breakfast often. it is been a long time since i have ordered an egg mcmuffin, so i indulged. i paid $1.19 drink upgrade for a large orange juice and i got a watered down juice so i went they the drive-thru and the lady was rude like i was the picky customer, i only want what i pay for and a little dash of politeness since they get paid for it!!!

the worst mcdonalds ever. complete chaos. the prices are higher than the average and they do not have all of the regular items like lattes or fraps. the staff seems to be uninterested in taking or completing your order. it is as if they are aware that you are pretty much at their mercy.

the worst mcdonalds ever. complete chaos. the prices are higher than the average and they do not have all of the regular items like lattes or fraps. the staff seems to be uninterested in taking or completing your order. it is as if they are aware that you are pretty much at their mercy.

whenever i travel alone, i tend to focus on trying places i would never see at home. ξbut whenever i travel with others, which is often, there is almost always someone who can not stomach the idea of eating something that is not familiar to them, so hence, i find myself at mickey d is. ξthis one out of terminal b is especially atrocious, even for the mediocre benchmarks of mcdonalds nationwide. ξi eventually fled to the adjacent panchito (yelp.com/biz/panchitos-m��_) which was equally terrible.the service at mcdonalds is never particularly outstanding, but when it is, it is especially worth noting, i just wish this place had it. ξthe woman at the register was painfully slow, which on airport time can be excruciating. ξafter paying the demons of airport overpricing, we continued to wait and wait ... to the point where i had to ask if our food was ever coming out.oh. ξthe fryer is broken? ξthanks for telling me that awhile ago when i ordered the stuff in the first place. ξwait, there are some nuggets / fries that are already made? ξthat does not sound particularly appetizing either. ξbut who am i to complain? ξthis is fast food after all.in the interest of saving time we grab the sack of soggy french fries and crazy hard nuggets while i sip on a deflated coke. ξhow does one screw up a soft drink? ξit still managed to happen here. ξand though i am not one to shy away from complaining, it was already too late. ξall of these discoveries were made while in our plane. ξcurses.

i know what your thinking...."another 1 star review for mcd is and you do not even eat there?!? what gives?" well i have to say this is an "informative" review! getting right down to it. i was out running by a few client sites today when i stopped and picked up lunch at riverside (that is right, be jealous). ξso, a coworker calls and asks if i would pick up lunch for her. ξbeing a team player i said no problem. she then told me she wanted satan...i mean mcdonalds. i sighed, but agreed. she told me what she wanted and off i went. oh and to get some ketchup and sweet and sour sauce. mkay. i pulled up to the drive thru and ordered after they tried to sell me their new angus burger. (sidenote: why do they do that in the first place? i mean, if that is what i wanted, i would have ordered it.) "may i please have #12 with a sprite." "would you l like to add on an apple pie for $.50?" "um, no." "$7.01, please pull up to the first window." so i pay. drive to window #2. man opens the window hands me the drink and the bag of food. i asked for a s&s sauce packet. the guy responded. "we charge for that now." "ha, that is hilarious. just one please." "no really, they are $.28" "what? you are kidding right?" "no ma'am, if you want one you will have to pull back around the drive thru." (totally dumbfounded i say) "do you charge for ketchup too?" then drive off. ξi laugh the entire way back to work like a crazy woman..."what do you mean your charging for condiments? " "is it laced with heroin?" "are there diamonds inside these packets?" "is charging for this even legal?" i mean it was not even my order and i am mad as hell. they have managed to piss me off again. congrats mcsatan. you officially suck more than ever. take your sweet and sour sauce and shove it where the sun do not shine. *spits on ground*
nasty ass restaurant. burnt ass chicken nuggets and the dumbasses working did not want to give me new ones.

if they went any slower, i would have grown a man beard. which is difficult seeing how i am a woman. i am sitting in the drive through as i write this. i have been here for 10 minutes without moving and there are only two of us in line. let me get out my shaving kit... while i wish i cared so little of deadlines and time constraints, i just want my coffee, dangit!

it really does not get much worse than this.when walking in, i (unfortunately) saw a young female worker grab the butt of a young male worker as she was walking to her register. ξthe guy then said to her: "if we ever closed this place together..." to which she replied: "we can not do that here!"i wish i was making this up...both of them had to be 18 or less, and did not take their job seriously at all. ξwhen i finally got my order (apparently there was no one helping bag orders for the front, as i had to wait for the two love-birds to finish all of the orders from the line before they realized nothing was being made -- to which they frantically started trying to put together about 20 orders), i realized as i was driving away that the girl who bagged my order gave me the wrong burgers.stay away. ξfar, far away. ξlike star wars "galaxy far far away" kind of far.does not matter how hungry and in need of quick calories i will be in the future, i would rather not eat than come here again.

food... although my nuggets were a little over cooked. the service.... i waited 15 minutes ( not exaggerating!) for my dollar burger and an order of nuggets. i will visit a different mcdonalds if i feel like having their food while i am in this area. chili is gets food to you in 15 minutes... and they are not considered a fast food restaurant.

i can not do zero stars so this place gets 1 star. ξthey nickel and dime you for sauces and add-ons here and, in spite of the fact that there is a neon sign that says "drive through open 24 hours" they are only open until 11pm. really???? 24 hour sign glowing and you close at 11pm?????

i can not do zero stars so this place gets 1 star. ξthey nickel and dime you for sauces and add-ons here and, in spite of the fact that there is a neon sign that says "drive through open 24 hours" they are only open until 11pm. really???? 24 hour sign glowing and you close at 11pm?????

is it possible to put no stars in this branch?i mean this place is probably in the top ten list of the worst mcdonalds franchises in history.they always screw up our order! it is either a missing burger or the wrong side item. what is really bad is you trust them to do it right and you discover that the order is messed up when you get home! so you go back right? they give you the missing item and simply say "...there you go, sorry." no bonuses, no here is something to make up for our crappy service, nothing like that!they will not give you ketchup or napkins unless you ask for it so if you forgot, you will be eating your fries as is!if you order a combo, they would ask you "...medium or large?" as if small is not an option, very tricky!when you order a breakfast meal, they would ask "do you want to have orange juice instead of coffee?" as if there is no difference in price and you have the option of choosing juice over coffee without extra cost. they will never tell you that should you make the mistake of choosing orange juice you will pay a lot more for the stupid upgrade!is this how mcdonalds became the most successful franchise? by tricking their own customers????!!!!do not bother to talk to the people in there... nobody cares...

worst mcdonalds ever! my boyfriend and i went through the drive through and ordered our food. we were told to pull up past the window to wait for our order. school was letting out so there was teens walking through the parking lot and about to fight right next to my car! finally after about 10 minutes my boyfriend gets out the car pissed and goes inside only to notice that the doors was locked. finally the security comes to the door with our order. horrible!

mannnn when i step into mcdonalds *obviously* healthy eating is not top priority, so put more salt onto my fries girl! seriously, my fries tasted like nothing... like it was healthy or something. disgusting. otherwise your average mcd with slightly higher prices since its midtown. oh yea they do not have trays if you wanna eat in, nor a ketchup stand with those small ketchup paper cups. so you just gotta rip off the paper bag and unleash packets of ketchup on it.hrmmm but it is 24/7 so... good drunk food?

consistently horrible service. shake & cafe machines are seemingly always "down". drive thru is excruciatingly slow & the employees are exceptionally chatty - with each other as opposed to helping us customers. i am still perplexed as to why i have to ask for a receipt with my transaction. shame on this location.

i rarely go to mcdonalds, but sometimes you just need your chicken mcnuggets or a hot fudge sundae or maybe a $1 ice cream.i biked over here once from usc and went inside to order and i will never do this again. i was asked multiple times for money and inside it was crowded, loud, dirty and there were some shady characters. in the middle of the day! they took forever to give me my order too. so if you are going to come here use the drive thru. then again, that takes forever as well. i have sat there waiting to get through the line for 15 minutes when all i ordered was an egg mcmuffin. fail.

i love mcdonalds, grew up on it and still take my boys there regularly and i have to say this. ξthe location off of the circle in summerlin really has some hard times keeping up. ξthe place always seems to be a bit dirty both in the lobby and behind the counter. ξi dread getting a "quick" bite with the boys when we are in a hurry as they are never fast in the drive thru!! ξbut the food is always just as good at any other mcdonalds, so they do have that going for them!! ξit is literally though one of the slowest mickey d is i have ever been to. ξand this is not just one experience, i go very regularly because as i said i love it and this one is the closest to me, so for convenience, but sometimes i wonder if it would be faster to drive seven minutes out of my way to another mcdonalds....their employees are so nice though, just not the best on the speed side of things!maybe they will get better!

the worst mcdonalds ever. complete chaos. the prices are higher than the average and they do not have all of the regular items like lattes or fraps. the staff seems to be uninterested in taking or completing your order. it is as if they are aware that you are pretty much at their mercy.

simply the worst mcdonalds i have ever been to. staff is rude, the place gets crowded and the food sucks.

sometimes you need to let loose...just do not do it here. ξdrive thru service is completely horrible. it is slow, workers do not speak english well, order screen is damaged and 9/10 times, there is a homeless person begging at the speaker box and another homeless person begging at the pick-up window. ξno exaggeration! everytime, yes, everytime i have gone to this drive-thru, they have screwed up my order. so you would better check what is in the bag before you drive off. the trick is to find that perfect timing of when to check what is in the bag, how to roll up your window to avoid the homeless beggar and how much time to take to examine your bag is contents without annoying the people behind you who have also been waiting for 20 minutes + in the same drive-thru. ξthis place is horrible.the food taste like mcdonald is food...but over-cooked or under-cooked. ξit is never just right. ξdo not bother with the frozen yogurt either. ξthe machine must be faulty because it comes out like a sloppy mess. ξthe food here only taste good if you are drunk but you would not be in the drive thru if you were drunk anyway! ;) i would rather go to near-by chano is mexican food.i have given this establishment multiple chances to prove me wrong but it has consistently under-delivered. ξit is the worst mcdonald is i have ever been to. ξi challenge you to experience this review for yourself and you will be surprised by its' truthful accuracy.bottom line, i would rather go hungry than go to this mcdonald is. they should pay you to eat here. the homeless people only beg here, not eat here...and that is saying something about a place that delivers nothing.see you for dessert...

i was telling a fellow yelper through another social media site that sometimes mickey d is hits the spot even for sunday night dinner as i was parking after a day hanging around the city at miami is 115th birthday. alas, i think i picked the wrong location.the food, when served correctly, is generic mcdonalds, tasted ok. the fries were even warm, and not salty. they had cherry pie (yes!) but:1. i paid for super-sized and while my soda was the correct size, they tried to pass regular fries for which i had to complain.2. i paid for the 2 cherry pies for $1 - and i know just one apple pie is 96 cents - but if i would not have complained i would have been ripped off 4 cents worth of food. 3. gotta love the two incidents of panhandling: one with the guy walking straight to my table, then another doing so to the patrons in line and then turning street preacher calling all sorts of armageddon on the place when the manager asked him to leave.dang, and it is not even full moon night!

the managers at this mcdonalds are awesome but some of the workers are lazy. ξoverall an average mcdonalds. ξafter visiting it and some other once i realized that this one is really average. ξthe only thing good about this one is that the management is awesome and its across the street from my house so i can sit around and study till midnight and no one bothers me.

it is currently going through renovation, which is great because that means less creepers in the front of the restaurant. also the sidewalks around the restaurant are disgusting. ξbut when it is open and you want a quick, cheap bite, it is fine.

best place on park avenue to meet homeless people, black who steal wifi @ 3:00am, and drunk angry people who were not granted access to the roof top bar across the street! do not forget to tip the homeless guy outside, though he opens the door for you!

why do i keep falling into this hellhole?!4 times, yes, 4, the most i chances i have given a place...either they:a) are out of whatever you want.b) have bad attitudes.c) give you cold food.d) give you melted down frozen strawberry lemonade that looks like puke, i should have taken a picture so that you would know i am not making it up.i am going to yell now, ready? stay away from this place!!!

if you like unhappy and rude customer service, this is the place. @1:30am its taking 17 minutes at the drive thru for 1 order of 20 piece mcnuggets. terrible. not coming back.

march 23, 2013 my experience at this mcdonalds was beyond describing. after waiting at the drive thru and then entering the store only to be told no mcfish bites and no ice cream and made to feel like an old man out of place, i was given the phone contact for mcdonalds' customer service by the store manager i was given 1-800-244-6277 dial this number. ξit is an asian sex phone line.and this number was given to me by the hispanic manager on duty, ms ella gonzalez. ξ i have this piece of paper in a bank vault. so if you are in need of having your big mac serviced, then call mcdonalds customer relations. they will bite your fish.

worst mcdonalds i have been to in my life. person at the drive thru stopped talking to me and when i rolled up to the windows they were extra rude. the total time it took me to get my meal was 20 minutes after i entered the drive thru. to top it off ξmy order was wrong. go figure. i called customer service to complain.

they have a bad service by drive-throughevery time i take my food it missing something or they give me different orderactually i do not like this location so now i stopped taking my food from there.just to review you this 1 star it is too much

you are in the drive thru at mcd is...you are not allowed to be angry that they got the order wrong. ξit's what they do. ξcheck the bag at the window. always. ξalways. ξmmmmmm fries and a shake. ξme likey.

another national chain spot that has no reviews. and with good reason. it is pretty pointless to review a mcdonald is. that is, unless you want the ftr!mcdonald is to me is good for one thing--their dollar menu. i am a sucker for the $1 mcdouble and maybe some fries. on road trips, the $1 one-price-fits-all-sizes fountain drink is priceless. unfortunately, not all mcdonald is locations stick to this pricing structure, but this location certainly does.i have never actually been inside, but their drive-thru has the nice face-to-face three-window system. i am not sure you need that third window just for ordering, but whatever. it works.

it is 2 for 1 review day! ξi can not review the walmart without reviewing the mcdonald is that resides inside. ξand boy is it some tantalizing stuff.i try not to give too many 1-star reviews but this mcdonald is so deserves it. ξi hardly frequent a mcdonald is at all (although this is my second mcdonald is review in less than a week) but i need to let the peeps in on this one. ξno yelper should go unwarned. ξof course i came to mcdonald is since i have those coupons for their new contraption, the mcwrap. ξwhich when i pronounce very fast and in my scottish accent sounds much like 'mccrap'. ξafter my second go round with this thing, i have made up my mind it is decidedly so. ξi need to write mcdonald is execs to change the name on this thing immediately.my coupon for the day was buy a medium fries and a medium drink, get a mcwrap of your choice for free. ξi have a hard time resisting free. ξi am here to tell you...worst almost free meal of my life!!! ξseriously.it was the tail end of lunchtime so the line was still a bit busy. ξi patiently waited for almost 10 minutes...which is like forever in mcdonald is time. ξat least two folks left the line while i was there. ξi know it is not mcdonald is fault, but the couple in front of me took up majority of the line space because they were in motorized wheelchairs. ξand they were very loud. ξthis does not bother me much. ξbut...they were also very stinky. ξyes, stinky. ξi have no problem with stinky in most cases (i occasionally help the homeless so i know) but the guy in front of me had not washed in days if i were to guess. ξto each his own, and i know it is almost summer so i know we all want to save water...but damn. ξif i get a whiff and i have to take a step back? ξyou might be s-t-i-n-k-y. ξbut who am i to judge? ξi took a big step back and waited my turn. ξfree is the motivation here. ξi finally get up there to the mcdonald is cashier and present my coupon to the guy. ξhe takes a look at it and says 'we do not usually take the promo coupons at this location but we will let you use it." ξthen he proceeds to put the coupon onto a stack of...more coupons! ξmind boggling to say the least. ξhe takes my order of a medium fries and medium drink, asks me what type of mcwrap i want (grilled chicken & bacon) and rings me up. ξ$2.91 later i am given my receipt and asked to wait for my number to be called.i wait. ξand wait. ξ#1! ξ#2! ξ#3! ξ#5! ξ#6! ξ#7! ξ#8! ξobviously i am #4 and 10 minutes later i am still waiting. ξhonestly, what the hell are you guys doing back there? ξmixing the masa for my fresh pressed tortilla? ξfeathering a chicken? ξperhaps ripening a tomato? ξi ask the mcdonald is runner and he tells me, "we are waiting for your mcwrap." ξof course.at this point i am almost running late to be back at work, so the minute i get my order i bolt back to the office and have lunch at my desk. ξthankfully i am only three minutes away. ξi really, really should have just gone to the vending machine or eaten my stash of reese is chocolate peanut butter eggs from last easter. ξtalk about disappointment! ξi take out my mcwrap from my bag and lay down the box of fries on my desk. ξi continue working while munching away on what is supposed to be mcdonald is claim to fame. ξtheir golden fries. ξi bite into one, eh a bit stale. ξi bit into another one, eh not enough salt. ξi bite into yet another one, eh cold?? ξi look down, and whaddaya know? ξmy damn fry is not even barely cooked! ξwhite like olivia wilde in the winter. ξi look through the entire box and find at least half a dozen fries not cooked properly! ξnot golden brown! ξnot delicious! ξbarely out of their frozen state, and just limp. ξnot acceptable! ξplease check my pic for proof of this travesty. ξmcdonald is not doing their fries right is like ikea not serving their swedish meatballs with gravy. ξno bueno.after getting over this somewhat i finally hit my stride to go on to my grilled chicken & bacon mcwrap. ξwow, talk about lightning striking twice. ξthis thing was lifeless! ξafter unwrapping this beast (the box is still the best part about this mcwrap), i could just tell something was off. ξtortilla was already showing signs of being soggy way too long. ξthe chicken peeking out of the top was not looking tip top shape either. ξafter some hesitation, i took a bite. ξugh i say, ugh! ξfreshness was not part of the gameplan for this mcdonald is today. ξall cold and soggy! ξand upon all, my mcwrap was not built correctly! ξinstead of having spring mix like it is supposed to, there was plain old shredded iceberg lettuce! ξand my bacon was missing! ξin the words of our lord darth vader....noooooooo! ξit was mccrap through & through. ξtotally upset over this one. ξi have picture proof of this travesty of gourmet eats as well. ξmcdonald is you have pissed off the wrong fatty. ξi will definitely be calling your hotline to complain about this one for sure. ξknowing my luck i will get a coupon for a free mcwrap. ξcrap.

ξyou might be s-t-i-n-k-y. ξbut who am i to judge? ξi took a big step back and waited my turn. ξfree is the motivation here. ξi finally get up there to the mcdonald is cashier and present my coupon to the guy. ξhe takes a look at it and says 'we do not usually take the promo coupons at this location but we will let you use it." ξthen he proceeds to put the coupon onto a stack of...more coupons! ξmind boggling to say the least. ξhe takes my order of a medium fries and medium drink, asks me what type of mcwrap i want (grilled chicken & bacon) and rings me up. ξ$2.91 later i am given my receipt and asked to wait for my number to be called.i wait. ξand wait. ξ#1! ξ#2! ξ#3! ξ#5! ξ#6! ξ#7! ξ#8! ξobviously i am #4 and 10 minutes later i am still waiting. ξhonestly, what the hell are you guys doing back there? ξmixing the masa for my fresh pressed tortilla? ξfeathering a chicken? ξperhaps ripening a tomato? ξi ask the mcdonald is runner and he tells me, "we are waiting for your mcwrap." ξof course.at this point i am almost running late to be back at work, so the minute i get my order i bolt back to the office and have lunch at my desk. ξthankfully i am only three minutes away. ξi really, really should have just gone to the vending machine or eaten my stash of reese is chocolate peanut butter eggs from last easter. ξtalk about disappointment! ξi take out my mcwrap from my bag and lay down the box of fries on my desk. ξi continue working while munching away on what is supposed to be mcdonald is claim to fame. ξtheir golden fries. ξi bite into one, eh a bit stale. ξi bit into another one, eh not enough salt. ξi bite into yet another one, eh cold?? ξi look down, and whaddaya know? ξmy damn fry is not even barely cooked! ξwhite like olivia wilde in the winter. ξi look through the entire box and find at least half a dozen fries not cooked properly! ξnot golden brown! ξnot delicious! ξbarely out of their frozen state, and just limp. ξnot acceptable! ξplease check my pic for proof of this travesty. ξmcdonald is not doing their fries right is like ikea not serving their swedish meatballs with gravy. ξno bueno.after getting over this somewhat i finally hit my stride to go on to my grilled chicken & bacon mcwrap. ξwow, talk about lightning striking twice. ξthis thing was lifeless! ξafter unwrapping this beast (the box is still the best part about this mcwrap), i could just tell something was off. ξtortilla was already showing signs of being soggy way too long. ξthe chicken peeking out of the top was not looking tip top shape either. ξafter some hesitation, i took a bite. ξugh i say, ugh! ξfreshness was not part of the gameplan for this mcdonald is today. ξall cold and soggy! ξand upon all, my mcwrap was not built correctly! ξinstead of having spring mix like it is supposed to, there was plain old shredded iceberg lettuce! ξand my bacon was missing! ξin the words of our lord darth vader....noooooooo! ξit was mccrap through & through. ξtotally upset over this one. ξi have picture proof of this travesty of gourmet eats as well. ξmcdonald is you have pissed off the wrong fatty. ξi will definitely be calling your hotline to complain about this one for sure. ξknowing my luck i will get a coupon for a free mcwrap. ξcrap.

so, i waited 15 minutes in the drive-thru to place an order for a large iced coffee. ξthe menu board thingy shows a $2.19 price, but the computer screen displaying the order shows a $2.29 price. ξafter another 5 minute wait, i finally get to the pay window and bring up the price to the cashier dude. ξhe says no one has ever mentioned a price discrepancy (my word, not his) and implies that i am lying or mistaken. ξhe says $2.29 is the price and there is no way around it. ξsay what there now? ξso i pull out of the drive-thru line, park my car, walk back to the menu board thingy, and take a picture of the $2.19 advertised price for a large iced coffee. ξi go inside and speak with victor the manager about the price issue and the long wait. ξhe does not believe me about the price (despite the picture) and goes to check it himself. ξwhen he returns, he says the girl who changes the menu board thingy is not in yet. ξi tell him that is an operational issue that has nothing to do with me. ξhe tries again, telling me $2.29 is the price because that is what the computer says. ξi remind (or perhaps inform) him that false advertising is against the law. ξhe does not seem to care. ξi press on (yes foolishly) about the price discrepancy, the hassle of getting out of my car to deal with it, the long wait, and the fact that no one has offered an apology. ξi could see i was going nowhere, so finally i ask for his name and store information so i can file a complaint. ξthen he mutters a half-baked "sorry," slides a dime across the counter to me, and walks away. ξthank you universe for the reminder that you get what you pay for. ξhow dare i expect anything other than this kind of service from a fast food place.

super slow!!! been here 6x and they never get my order right!!! will never come back here! i always ordered well done fries and i always get saggy fries that probably been sitting around for more than an hour. ~__~ i went to go to drive thru and the lady told me to wait 10 minutes at front parking lot 18minutes later still nothing so i decided to go drive at the drive thru. the lady told me to go back to the front and wait 10 minutes i told her i have been waiting for 18 minutes. they so slow!!! and probably not even doing their job. i own the business across the street and they always waste my time. today, i asked for that oreo mcflurry i think and they said "yes" they have some so it is cool, then when i went to pay, they told me "i am sorry we do not have some at the moment and we will refund your money and you can take the rest of your order at the 2nd window" ~__~ whoever the manager here for sure does not know how to manage. i hope mcdonalds pay attention to this location. they need better people inside!!!

all i wanted was a mcflurry but 14 minutes in the drive thru made it impossible. i left empty handed and upset. oh well, sonic shake it is for me then! btw, drive through lady was hard to understand, they need to hear themselves through that speaker. simply terrible, but then again we are in the hood and the next closest location is still in the hood. next time i will just stop by the store and buy a tub rather than go through this hassle and headache.

stopped in the drive thru at this location for a mcdouble at around 9:30pm. i asked for it to be made without salt on the meat. when i get to the window, the lady said rather rudely that they could not make it that way because...get this...they had already cooked all the meat for the night and the grill was closed down.i said, "so if i drive up and order a burger at 4am, you are telling me that you are going to serve me meat that was cooked 8 hours ago?" she said, "yeah, well that is the way all mcdonald is operate."disgusting. i know mcdonald is is not exactly known for the highest standards, but serving burgers made "fresh to order" with 8-hour-old cooked meat is just downright nasty.

this is the worst mcdonalds in the area. ξthe food is always stale. ξdo yourself a favor and go to the one in garwood. ξthey serve fresh food at that location.

every time i come here, my booking for a party is messed up or my meal is incorrect or incomplete. i come because its close but there are closer. the play place i no longer allow my kids in since the last few time they became ill. the bathroom in the play place has this extra tall toilet, why? kids are the ones going to use it the most. well, at least i can not say it was unexpected.

what is a shamrock shake? it is a seasonal shake (milk?) by mcdonald is with green food coloring thrown in designed to exploit another made up holiday, st. patty is day. you can tell it is fake as crap because the food coloring they throw in does not blend well. parts of the shake will be a deep shade of green and then rivers of white will intertwine with lighter shades of green. this is your first warning : there is nothing natural about this drink, proceed at your own risk. in the name of yelp, i purchased a shamrock shake to review. what does it taste like? at first... not bad actually. like a melted down andes mint, cooled and thrown into a shake. it does not quite taste like a milkshake, it just tastes like a chocolate mint melted down.this is good for awhile... until you reach the halfway point and you are disgusted and want no part of the shake. not sure if it was just overkill for me, or if its the shake in general. worth a try, bu nothing to call home about.

i was craving fast food - had not had it in weeks - so i decided to try this mcdonald is on my lunch break. ξthe food sucked. ξthe nuggets had no taste. ξgrease was dripping from my fries. ξthe ice machine was out of ice. ξa homeless man was walking around the store begging for money. ξi think i am going back to my non-mcdonald is/non-fast food ways.

first-i know it is a mcdonald is. so what could i expect? ξhow about a clean space and staff that at least pretended to care.this store is close to the house and our grandson wanted his birthday party here.the store had a recent makeover and on first appearances is a very nice location. they obviously spent some money on the makeover. ξthat is why the cleanliness, or lack thereof, was rather shocking. the dining area by the children is play area appears to be an afterthought when they are cleaning. ξi ended up cleaning our tables myself since no one seemed to care enough to come wipe down tables ξor throw away trash. ξthe food was standard fare at mcdonald is but they were really slow filling the orders and it was only lukewarm when we got to the tables.the play area also had one other major issue. ξthey have a little area with animals for the smaller kids to crawl around on. ξi give them points for that and trying to keep the really wee ones away from the bigger kids. ξi would have thought that someone would have though of affixing the animals in some way so they would not tip over when the kids were on them- a definite safety hazard.not a store i care to revisit. luckily my grandson is now 5 and his palate will soon outgrow mcdonald is!

this mcdonald is has the lowest hiring standards in all of houston. i went to the drive thru with my fiancee and she only ordered a large drink - half sprite half hic orange and the drive thru guy said they could not do it because of the way the soda dispenser is. are you guys that stupid? could no one walk their lazy asses to use the dispenser out in the lobby? or dispense "small sprite" and then "small hi-c orange"?????!!!!!!!! a five year old could figure it out!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
all i can say is this is the only mcdonalds that charges you $1.20 for substituting sausage for bacon on the big breakfast. all they give you is one and a half slices!!

i realize mcdonald is is meant to be fast food, but to call this one particular location fast food is an oxymoron, unless waiting 30 minutes to get your items (and half the time they are incorrect), can pass as fast food now. ξi do not know why my friend keeps insisting on stopping here for a drink, it would be faster to stop at walgreens, get out of the car, get a bottle of coke, pay, and get back in the car to drive off. ξi believe the addition of a second drive-thru lane has created a bigger problem. ξthis is causing more congestion as the one right lane blocks people who have ordered in the left lane from being able to advance and join the main paying lane (which forces both lanes to immediately merge), especially if the ones in the right lane tailgate and will not let you in, even though you placed your order before them, which would imply your order would come up first. ξyou can easily sit in that left lane for 10 minutes while the people behind you are helpless and honk uselessly trying to move up to place their order. ξin addition, the cashier has a hard time dispensing the correct items and keeping track of who ordered what. ξwe ordered a soda but were handed a bag with burgers and fries, which we promptly returned. ξthe associate then asked us if we were sure we had not ordered that...uh, what?? seriously?! way to take responsibility for your mistakes. ξnext time this happens, we will just take the burger and fries and get a drink elsewhere, instead of being subjected to this stupid questioning and eternal waits.

pretty nice mcdonald is, one of the nicer ones i have been too, and the food is solid mcdonald is quality. service is a little slow however, but waiting for chicken nuggets or a mcflurry is totally worth it. great place for a quick bite around usc.

this is the mcdonald is that my friends and i always go to since it is the closest to our apartment but at the same time, it is definitely the worst one i have ever been to.one plus is that their drive-thru is open 24 hours but sadly, the later at night you go, the more often your choices are limited. for example, one day we were craving their vanilla cone but they said that their ice cream machine was off already so they could not make it! okay. what is the point of staying open 24 hours if you can not even give the customers the food they want?!the other day, i had a pretty bad dine-in experience. the lady behind the counter charged extra for big mac sauce on the mcdouble which i have never experienced before. usually going through drive-thru, they never charge extra for a mcdouble w/o the ketchup, w/ big mac sauce and shredded lettuce (a.k.a a big mac, but cheaper!). my boyfriend and i were pretty shocked when she told us we had to pay extra for the sauce and she claimed that they always do this which they really never do!!then, this same lady proceeded to close the cash register before giving me my change! she told me to wait on the side so she can give it to me after she opens it for the next customer. so i patiently waited... and then she closed the cash register again after the next customer and totally forgot to give me my change!!!! so i had to remind her again to which she just laughed and semi-apologized and then finally gave me my change after like a decade of waiting! argh! worst mcdonalds worker ever!! completely rude and horrible customer service skills! i totally agree with my boyfriend who said this mcdonalds is very poorly managed. he even wrote a complaint to them a while back but they never responded. "we love to see you smile?" i beg to differ.

i know its mcdonalds but this was the worse experience ive had ever in a mickey ds...got coupon for a free smoothie - with purchase of any sandwich or salad ξ( no dollar menu items)ok ordered a cheeseburger, girl insisted its in the dollar menu...i said no, she said yea...so i said ok fine, let me get a southern chicken sandwich ξ- she asked if grilled or fried - i said fried...ok good...but i was still mad that cheeseburger is not in the dollar menu....anyways, order comes...we were in a hurry, paid w debit card...done deal....wen we get the bag its a f***** salad....wackness....i swear, but i got no time to argue, or change the salad to sandwich and go thru debit/credit processing to change prices etc....so it was double wack....then i get home, guess what.....there a long hair on the salad....

i was just there a few days ago. ξi ordered my daughter a kids meal thru the drive thru. ξthe women at the first window was very nice and professional. ξwhen we drove to the next window to pick up our food the women just handed us the juice then handed up our kids meal. ξthe whole time talking to fellow coworkers. ξwe saw only the back of her the whole time. ξno hello no thank you or anything. ξit was the weirdest thing. ξmy husband and i were shocked that happen. ξsorry mcdonalds we were bothering you. ξthe funny thing i think she was the manager because she was wearing a different color than everyone else.

they just officially lost my business. the drive through female and male were both extremely rude. the girl took my order and then just disappeared. i asked for my total and then a guy comes through the drive through speaker. i ordered a sausage egg mcmuffin minus the sausage with extra egg. the wanted to charge me for that!!! i work in the food service industry so i have an idea of the food cost. so i will drive the extra miles and go to jack n the box... not one more penny is going to the most successful, over payed fast food ξfranchise ξwho begs for our money all the time for "charity". hope the 1 egg and worst customer service was worth losing the business that my friends and family gave you. fyi.. jack n the box charges also but they are way nicer and actually make it fresh. thanks jack for hiring decent ppl. could you train ronald

management is very rude here, i bring my son every now and then to play ξand have witnessed on several occasions the manager who is a female was extremley rude. i was shocked at her behavior. i still go there because its close to my house.

went through the drive-thru today at about 11:15 am for lunch. ordered the habanero quarter pounders and a caramel sundae. sundae machine was down, so no sundae. i should have taken that as an omen and just left. got the promo to buy a quarter pounder & get one free. when i went to eat my sandwich i had to search for the habanero sauce( just a touch was on the bun), and the burger was dry as hell and tasted like it had been reheated from the day before. i took one bite and could barely chew it. i threw them both away. what a waste of gas and time. never going to this place again ... ξaw

another national chain spot that has no reviews. and with good reason. it is pretty pointless to review a mcdonald is. that is, unless you want the ftr!mcdonald is to me is good for one thing--their dollar menu. i am a sucker for the $1 mcdouble and maybe some fries. on road trips, the $1 one-price-fits-all-sizes fountain drink is priceless. unfortunately, not all mcdonald is locations stick to this pricing structure, but this location certainly does.i have never actually been inside, but their drive-thru has the nice face-to-face three-window system. i am not sure you need that third window just for ordering, but whatever. it works.

three cardinal sins:1) the ice cream cones cost twice as much here as other locations around chicago. granted, this means i am paying $1.08 instead of $0.54. some might say it is pointless to critique this - it is just fifty cents! but i say, no! they are charging twice the price. name another thing sold anywhere at a franchise where the price can vary so wildly. also, i hate mcdonald is, and the only reason i go there is because they are losing money by serving me under-priced ice cream cones - they can not possibly profit from this. moreover, c amon, an ice cream cone for fifty cents on hot chicago day? who could pass that up? not even me, a mcdonald is-hating hippie.2) complete chaos at the ordering station, even with very little line.3) pigeons being fed in the outdoor seating area - by an employee - who alternated from cursing at the pigeons to (when they got too close to her) throwing fries to get them to get away. does she not realize that feeding them just keeps those nasty-ass pigeons around?

so incredibly peeved! i went to the drive-thru to grab a quick lunch before i went into the office. i bought 2 cheeseburgers, and when i got to my office, i found there was only one cheeseburger. this was supposed to be my lunch... the sticker on the bag that says "double checked for accuracy" is just laughing at me right now. either they did not double check it, or they do not know how to count. i do not understand the satisfaction of scamming 99 cents from customers, but whatever makes you sleep at night i guess.the only reason i ever go to this mcdonalds is because it is close to usc and close to my apartment. i really dislike this mcdonalds. really really dislike.oh. and you will almost always get homeless/hobos loitering outside, asking you for money.

i do not know what the deal is with this location, but they are ridiculously slow! even if my order is a pre made salad and iced coffee and there is no one else in the drive-thru lane, it still takes forever!

my friend and i came here to grab a quick bite before heading to the rei garage sale. ξlet is set the stage:ext mcdonald is drive-through windoworder placed: #3 on the breakfast menu, oatmeal, and a coffee with one cream two sugars. ξdriver goes to first window pays. ξinstead of returning the card quickly, the cashier proceeds to have a 3-minute girl-talk with another coworker.car drives to second window. ξdriver and passenger watch a dude make instant oatmeal. ξit appears to take several minutes. ξworker disdainfully hands a bag and coffee to the driver. ξdriver asks passenger (me) to check the order as driving away. ξno oatmeal inside nor a spoon.driver parks, walks back in, retrieves said missing items, tiredly gets back in car. driver happily looks on the coffee, which was not prepared according to order.^perhaps not a tragedy, but definitely a comedy of errors that tells me not to patronize this mcdonald is again.

when i am really craving for mcdonald is, this seems to be the closest. but i am no big fan of fast food chains.i do not like this location just because there are bums inside waiting for the bus to go to atlantic city or whatever...they usually sit and chat and drink some coffee. same food as any other mcdonald is & waitresses are friendly!

work nearby so used to stop for drive thru breakfast items. poorest mcdonalds i have ever been to and with five miles of world headquarters in oak brook. i would say they got my order correct about 45 percent of the time. the manager after a time recognized me when i parked and came in for order correction. it is not only me, i work in a 80 persons office and when i see someone carrying a mc donald is before i can ask , they begin to tell me how their coffee or sandwich was wrong. my biggest grip is paying for extra condiments (syrup) and not getting it . it is on my receipt ..... staff cannot read or when you ask them , they lie to you they put in. i know bigger problems to worry about in world. but when you pay extra for something and then get lied to ....... hello burger king......
your better off eating in the restaurant, as long as you do not see the counter cause just that alone will get you sick! ξthe drive thru 9 out of 10 times always forgets something on your order.

paid the "airport mark-up" price for the worst big mac that i have ever had. ξthe bread was over-toasted to cover up the staleness of the bun...it did not. ξthe, big mac, which is supposed to be a relatively tall sandwich was not much taller than a mcdouble from the value-menu...which they do not have at the airport, btw.

there is one reason and one reason alone that my family comes to this mcdonald is - and it is the playplace. with nv is awful winter wind and scorching summers, it is a nightmare place for kids that need to run off some steam. we come here with my 5 year old sister and 8 year old brother so they can run around and to grab a drink. usually, this location is packed with kids. this mcdonald is is more expensive than other ones.
