this is the only mcdonald is i have ever been to (and i have been to many, in the us and elsewhere, over the years) where only one person is ever taking orders....which obviously causes a large group of people waiting, waiting, waiting for their food...and it does not matter what time you come in. ξevery single time! no matter what time of day you go there. ξthey need to tighten up their game!!! seriously.

mcdonald is is what mcdonald is is, and normally i would not bother to review a chain that most of us have eaten at once or twice or a hundred times that has quick mediocre food, but my experience here was noteworthy.i came here with a friend just before 11 pm after getting cookies from a nearby business which closes at 10. ξwe got some hot chocolate (which i thought would be safe) and sat with our cookies.there is a 20 minute seating limit (which we exceeded by several hours as we were catching up), ξand as the night wore on people were mostly coming in wasted and trying to convince the security guard to let them into the bathroom (which is closed from 12 am -7 am... truly, as the sign says, no exceptions.) the restaurant was dirty, there were a few moments where i felt a little unsafe as drunk kids fought with their friends in line, and to top it off it took like 10 minutes to get our hot chocolates, (there was an issue with their machine), and while drinking mine, i came across a gob of congealed milk, the texture of which can only be compared to phlegm. ξif you must have mcdonald is, do not go to this one: not to sit for a few hours, not to pee, and for the love of god, not to eat.

i rarely go to mcdonalds but one day i was thinking about the chocolate dipped ice cream comes i used to get as a kid and i decided to stop by and get one. not only did they not have them but when i compared their menu to the corporate menu, i realized they do not have many of the items that are supposed to be part of the standard menu.

rude staff and cold fries! i would have given one star but the inside looks nice. modern and clean. my friend was told she could get iced coffee with her meal with no extra charge then was charged $1 extra.

rude staff and cold fries! i would have given one star but the inside looks nice. modern and clean. my friend was told she could get iced coffee with her meal with no extra charge then was charged $1 extra.

i do not know what it is about this particular corner and this particular mcdonald is but both are run amok with seedy characters.i have seen prostitutes in there eating with their pimp. ξacross from them, by the window, is this guy who is always there on his laptop (free wi-fi, maybe?). ξhe looks like he has not showered in a good decade. ξone crackhead did the harlem shake in front of me once.it is just a ghetto mcdonald is. ξit makes the one down by west 4 st. seem really nice.

worst mcd is ever. looks fancy but management obviously does not care about service. my sister wanted some fries and a cheeseburger one night after playing some pool at rack daddy is so i headed over to this location because it is a block away from home. after paying them $5 for something i am sure cost them about a nickel i asked if i could have a dipping sauce or two for the fries."no. you have to order a 10 piece nugget or more for sauces. sorry." ...then closed the drive through door and walked away. are you fking kidding me? i knew i should have just gone to the whataburger another block north on coit, and next time i will.

this particular location needs to work on customer service.

ok, so i arrive here with a coupon that says 'order 1 extra value meal and get a like sandwich. ξkey word...'like'. ξmy options for my meal included either 1 big mac or 2 cheeseburgers. ξi order 2 cheeseburgers. ξthen for my sandwich i request 2 additional cheeseburgers. ξthe manager tells me 'no, i can only get 1, not 2. ξduhhh...i said "why do u think 'like' is emphasized in the wording"??? ξagain she said, i can only get 1 sandwich, not 2. ξfine. ξof course, then i looked for the biggest sandwich i could find....the bacon angus cheeseburger which i think may cost more than the value meal alone and quite frankly probably should not be honored since it was not a part of the deal to begin with. ξoh well.....on top of that i am still callin' corporate to complain.....i am entitled to my 2 cheeseburgers.
guilty as charged. man, when it is late and i am taking the d train home...do you really need a review of mcdonald is? lines are fairly quick and the food is poison, but appealing poison. right?

i never thought i would write a review of a mcdonalds, much less have to write a negative review for a mcdonald is. i do not even know how it is possible that a mcdonald is could be so bad but unfortunately this one is. ξ like many people, i have eaten at mcdonalds all over america and even in several other countries. ξi have to say this is probably one of the worst mcdonald is i have ever been to other than the one in manila in the philippines -and that is only because i am not sure that what was in those burgers was even beef.where do i begin? the service is terrible. i have never, not one time, gotten what i ordered. i get sweet tea when i ask for unsweetened. i get cheese when i ask for none. i get onions when i ask for none. i get 2 chicken sandwiches when i ask for 4 apple pies. ξi have given up on going through the drive thru because i always end up having to pull around, park, go in and wait in the long line of teenagers getting shakes ξjust to get them to correct my order. and even then, they do not get it right and i actually have to tell them, "no see, this is a chicken sandwich, i ordered a mcdouble."the food is almost always cold. the burgers are dry and taste like they have been sitting on a shelf for more than an hour. and the fry is..ugh! when there are 6 cars in the drive thru and 20 people in line, i just do not understand how the fry is can be cold and stale. it absolutely defies logic. yes, there are times that the food comes out hot. it is one of the reasons i keep going back. there is nothing like hot fry is from mcdonalds.. and also, just because it is mcdonald is. like it or not, it is a staple for working parents too tired to cook dinner after work some nights. it is unfortunate that they have no competition in the immediate area to keep them on their toes, otherwise they might actually try to improve their service and their product. i am sure they are turning a profit. no doubt. it seems to always be busy. however, i truly believe that if any other burger joint opened up right next door, this place would close down in a month. every time i say i am never going back, i still do. unfortunately, tonight will be one of those nights as the kids specifically requested it. the shear dread of what i am about to go through is what prompted this review. ξi really hope they improve. it hurts to have to knock a mcdonald is.

good location, s-l-o-w service. ξfunny crew, on a trip through the drive thru, the cutie taking my order for a happy meal, asked if i would like a girl or a boy toy?, i excitedly answered "oh!, i will take a boytoy!", he must of thought i was a dirty old lady, he would be half right!

this place is infamous for having a rude cashier and not having things in stock. complaints to management here go on deaf ears. i go out of my way to go to the one on durango cause of so many bad experiences here- this location really gives the brand a bad name!

came to this mcdonald is a couple of times and tried to order a few drinks and their machine did not work for anything. no hot chocolate no hot mocha no anything. on top of that the lady in the drive thru said it has not worked for a couple of months. a multi million dollar company and they can not fix the machines? ξwth? not coming to this mcd again. ξand they are slow 10 mins to get a drink.
place looks like new outside but it is dirty inside. ξlong line one person at the register. ξif ξwas another mcdonald is close by i would leave.

"hello, would you like to try our hot chocolate?"oh man, how i hate the prerecorded message at this drive-thru. no, i do not want the hot chocolate. no, i do not want the frappe fizz. no, i do not want whatever piece of crap food item you are happening to push at the present moment ...i do not want it!i only want what i order and what i came in to purchase.when will you get that? in the morning, this is the busiest mcdonalds i have ever come across. usually, there is a line in the drive-thru snaking into the street. the parking lot is poorly designed, making it difficult to leave once you grab your order. the loop comes full circle, and you are blocked by people in a secondary line entering from belt line road northbound.just give me my freakin' egg biscuit, cut the high pressure up-selling, and let me get the heck out of here ...

kids working drive thru have no idea what they are doing. usually wait in the pick up window long enough to drink my entire drink and the food is still not ready. they usually forget to add salt to the fries. today i got sold a pie that said to ' enjoy by 7:41pm ' and was sold to me at around 10pm. i am not even sure if that is safe to eat. disapointed in the new location. and a few napkins in my drive thru bag would be nice too.

this place is quite sub par, even for a mcdonald is. ξthis place is really ghetto, and there is always a bunch of annoying kids loitering and taking up the available tables. ξi guess it is ok if you want to grab a soda on a hot day or a snack to munch on while walking around, but again, it is not very good... for your health or for taste. ξi say, exert some self-discipline, buy something worthwhile in walmart is grocery section, then go home and prepare something worth eating.

had ordered a big mac and jalapeno double and it is the first time i had to call and let them know how the food is. the big mac is lettuce was soggy and old and the jalapeno double had little to no sauce and three jalapeno slices. the fries were refried over and over cause they were brown and way over salted. i called and the manager was super nice apologized and offered me two meals at no cost and never mentioned i needed a receipt because i had already told her i threw it away. she said she would just write down my name and put it in the books. i take up the offer on a different day and they do not know what i am talking about, i pay but get home and the buns are burnt and the order was wrong again. i asked for no meat on the mcmuffin for my daughter and what do they add on, meat. yeah i can take it off myself but the point is is obviously they do not listen to there customers or just do not pay attention, i mean every encounter there they always forget, or simply make a mistake. either way i am taking my business else where. management is not organized and you can not trust their words! the crew is super nice though! i did not want to have to post this or the pictures but they are not listening so maybe they need to see it, pretty sure i would not need a receipt now.

this is the worst mcdonald is i have ever been to.yes, there are better mcd is out there. like the one on boulder highway by joker is wild, right before you hit warm springs.i have visited the last two nights here....because i was picking up a friend of mine who got off from work, and we had a sweet tooth.....along with my family members at the house.yesterday, we pull up and ask for hot fudge sundaes. ice cream machine is out.instead, we get two large sweet teas.....which were overly sweet. almost...gave off a syrup feel after i swallowed.tonight, the ice cream machine is working, so i get two sundaes, and of course, two large sweet teas.sundaes look sad, because they are not in their proper clear plastic cup...they are instead in mini mcflurry cups....(not even filled completely, might i add.)my friend and i take one sip of our sweet teas....and they taste like dirty water.it is almost like they were trying to trick us.....like, they did not have enough tea, so they filled 3/4 of the cup with water.... seriously, if i wanted the taste of unfiltered water, i would just pick up a hose out of someone is back yard. the women who work here, hate their lives. i mean, they are just wretched.one of the cars parked by the drive thru was.....vandalized with shaving cream, and what appeared to be eggs... ca not say i blame the perpitrator when these ladies can not even pour a glass of tea. .....i do not condone it, but hey, some people are crazy about their food.

clean restaurant. always packed and you can bet your lunch that no one there will speak english. service is usuallly slow and the parking lot is a nightmare.
crazy noisy screaming kids here add to the usual ambiance of dirty tables, hard to understand counter staff and the typical gourmet food offerings. ξanother day in minimum wage heaven!

i enjoyed the part where i repeatedly asked if i had the right sauce 4 times...then did not. fuck you mcdonalds.

why are the store hours on the door? why are they not on this page? it is a 0 rating from me because they are closed and there are no ξhours posted. starving, craving a bacon egg cheese biscuit and no idea what time 4am? 5am? tired and hungry after a long night of work ... closed... on this sight everything else about the place but the hours!i will never go there!

like the other reviewer zee r. i live near by and was going frequently since march 2014 for morning breakfast and i have had this same problem! missing hash brown, missing chocolate chip cookies, missing one of my rounded egg in deluxe breakfast! ξit is a hassle to drive back up to get my complete meal by the time i get home everything is cold! ξsheesh!

pretty simple review, i work the early morning shift and they are open 24 hours. ξi have gone twice in the past week to get a coffee and one time they had to pull out the pot and start making it and the other time they told me they only were accepting cash!!!one thing you should have at that hour is coffee and i supsect something sketchy with the girl only accepting cash, will not be going here again

this place makes half size mcwraps for full price, see picture. you can complain to manager and get it fixed, but i do not think there should be need to involve a manager every time i buy a mcwrap, i should get what i pay for.

this is a mcdonald is express, so it sadly does not have the entire menu at all times. ξit reminds me that advertisements often include "participation and availability may vary by location" notices - this would be one of those cases. ξfortunately, the smaller menu means fewer different things for their cooks to remember how to prepare or distract them from these key menu items.over half of the times i have been in here, no matter how busy, i have had my food handed to me in less than 2 minutes from paying for it. ξthat is express, people!the only thing that drags this place down is the atmosphere. ξthe counter is tiny and only holds two registers, so at any busy point in time, the line of people engulfs the only walking space and makes its way to the door, and sometimes extends out the door, though i have only seen that during dinner times as i have passed by on my way home from unique or something.the soda machine has once or twice been low on syrup, yielding a nasty beverage - but it is outside the counter, so you can refill it with something else on your own. ξthe tables for sitting are very close together, meaning it is difficult to eat your food in peace at this location without being bothered by someone is family issues or rampant children. ξit can get very loud here.but all in all, if you are stopping in for something to go, this is a great place for that. ξjust make sure to check that what you want is on their smaller menu, and take note that sometimes the sales regular mcdonald is can have on menu items does not necessarily apply here. ξso pay attention, and then you can enjoy your mcdonald is food.and you will enjoy it better at home instead of sitting in cramped quarters with rambunctious broodlings.

this might be the prettiest mcdonald is in the area. ξit was recently rennovated in the prairie style (frank lloyd wright is a big attraction here in oak park) and it resembles a lovely hotel lobby. ξstained glass, woodwork, even a fireplace! ξthe reason they did this is that ray kroc, mcdonald is founder, was from oak park.they really need to remodel the staff, though. you do not expect these folks to be rocket scientists (like jackson r.) but a simple order for two people should not have three mistakes! ξi love their asian chicken salad, but half the time i have to ask for the right dressing, or the packet of almonds is missing. ξthe ugly tiny mcdonald is in the basement of children is hospital gets it perfect every time.
so horrible no matter what time of day it is, you will always get food that has been prepared so messy.

i went to this mcdonald is for dinner and after i ordered my food and pulled up to the window they handed me a drink caddy with my drinks and two glasses in it that i did not ask for. (i believe they charged me for these without me knowing, unless they are free.) then i was instructed to pull forward and wait. i have had this happen before and it usually is not a big deal. after waiting for a little bit the guy came out with my food. when inspecting it i asked him for my other french fry and he went in and grabbed it. when he came back i had inspected the bag a little more and realized i had an extra 10 piece chicken nugget but was missing another double cheese burger. when i informed him of this he looked at me and told me i was wrong because he made it himself. at this point i was very frustrated after being called a liar over a freaking cheese burger. i asked him to look in the bag and he took it back inside corrected the order by taking back the nuggets (probably to resell them) and replacing it with a burger. (only one of the burgers were made right) when handing me the bag he waved the receipt in my face (something i never received a copy of) and told me it is right now because i have your receipt. i would expect it to be right only to get home and find out that it was not. this is not the first time i have had a problem at this location and i am a little tired of spending my money at a place that obviously does not appreciate it.

went in her about a month ago and order a breakfast taco and a chicken biscuit for breakfast. ξthe breakfast taco was good, but the ckn biscuit literally looked days old. i contacted mcdonalds corporate via email to let them know. the kindly responded in email and with a call as well as send me a certificate for a free breakfast on the. ξi think cool they responded super fast and reasonably. so i take my coupon down to the same mcdonalds and the guy at the register who could barely speak english proceeded to tell me i could not use it unless i ordered and paid for 1 breakfast meal as well. not being able to convince him of what the coupon clearly said, i just left. i emailed corporate twice again, but no response.

it was raining when i went to this mcdonald is drive thru. a noteworthy point: do not go thru the drive thru in rainy weather. it is not covered at the order speaker and there is inadequate coverage at the order windows as well. i ordered a ten piece nugget combo large with fries. the nuggets had gristle in them and several seemed undercooked. the large dr. pepper was tasteless: they had let the syrup run out. i did not notice the drink until we left. overall, i was disappointed. the fries were good though. the drive thru order taker was courteous though so i have to give them points for that.

the customer service was horrible! ξthey seemed angry to work here and they would get upset if you ask for more ketchup or condiments. also, the kids play area was filthy. it had old dirty food on the floor and it was ξfull of lint. stay away from this location.

worst mcdonald is ever. the service is terrible. it is worse than going to the dmv. in fact i rather go to the dmv, however sometimes i need some quick food and it is open 24/7. everything about this place is absurd, the drive through makes you place the order at the window and they take 20 plus mins to get to you. they randomly close the doors when they feel like it even though it says 24/7 lobby. the employees need better training. there are mentally disabled homeless people that can do a better job of taking your order. this mcdonald is needs an intervention...

i do not need to review the food as everyone knows what it is like either way, depending on their opinion.this location is one of the biggest i have ever been in, and has free wi-fi. however, what makes this place special is the vast assortment of fairly crazy people that hole up here. i am hardly unsympathetic to the homeless, but if you have been here, you know what i am talking about. try it...it is quite an adventure. def some regulars that set up camp who are just plain off, which can make it uncomfortable sometimes. i actually feel a bit sorry for the staff for all the daily crap they must have to endure. belligerent customers who are mentally ill and have plenty of free time. it must be fairly soul-crushing, but most of the workers manage to still be polite.

this is the only mcdonald is near my work and probably for everyone else unless you you drive south into dt portland or go across the bridge. tried to give this place a chance after a couple of screw ups but i just can not do it anymore. and here is why.one, look at the storefront photo. i uploaded that photo here at the time of this review but it was originally taken early in the year (mainly because i had another bad experience and i need to tell everyone not to come here any more because they suck.)so the first time, as the photo shows, a dead small black fly on the lettuce in my classic crispy chicken sandwich. i usually order it without mayo and when i got my sandwich the 1st time, guess what? it had mayo. i just do not get why they can not read instructions properly or anything. why can not the condiment be separate and not default? it is so frustrating. any way, 2nd time i got the sandwich, they "got it right" except for the fly part. i already went in my car so i said "f it" so i just took the picture as proof and then ripped the contaminated area on the lettuce.i did not go to this location for awhile after this incident, but i was craving chicken mcnuggets and so since it is not a fresh produce item or whatever, i decided it would not be a big deal. boy was i wrong. i think this might have happened twice but i counted my nuggets and it was missing 1 in the 10 or 20 piece meal. i should not have to count how many nuggets i have, but sadly these people can not do their job. i do not even get much time to eat lunch so i did not have time to go back and complain. i am done with this location any way so if i am craving a sandwich or chicken mcnuggets from here, i will just drive across the bridge and go there because it probably is not crap like this location. they know they are serving a ton of people since they are the only location but they just do such a bad job. the fries are a bit overpriced too and some other things in case any of you were thinking you can get a decent deal on large fries. the best place for that would be the beaverton location near uwajimaya off highway 10 (i think that is it.)conclusion: if you crave mcdonalds, don  not go to this location unless you want dead flies in ξyour burgers/sandwiches or missing chicken mcnuggets.

you burned my coffee. you guys burned my coffee. first time i ever ordered coffee from you and you burned it. i usually go to the starbucks right across the street because they usually do not burn my coffee. i attempted to try out your establishment because you guys advertise your coffee so much on all sorts of media implicating that it is good coffee that is not burned. but after giving tender, i received a burned coffee. this will be the last time i visit you to buy a burned coffee. you burned my coffee. burn.p.s. dear cashier lady. i know you were not the one who physically burned my coffee so my earlier comments do not apply to you. but i did ask twice for a chorizo and not a sausage burrito. i would have overlooked this had you not been so mean to me. i hope you enter a starbucks one day and your coffee is burned.

one thing remarkable about this restaurant, in contrast with all the other many restaurants in the east village --every type of person in the neighborhood eats here. old folks, kids, black, white, hispanic, asian, sane, crazy, homeless, homeful...crossing every line there is. no other restaurant accomplishes that. now, whether all those different people should eat at mcdonald is is another matter...be great if they would introduce an "east village history" theme -- pictures of emma goldman, yippies, ee cummings, etc. one last thing. there are people who like mcdonald is coffee...why???

i went here on a friday night about 8pm, originally just to use their redbox machine but hey, i am a sucker for burgers and fries! there was one other person in the store (waiting for their order), ~3 cars in the drive through, 4 or 5 staff behind the counter, and somehow i still waited 6-8 minutes at the register and not one person took my order. they seemed to be new staff or something, because it was a hot mess back there, apparently order mishaps and things over fried something.anyways, i eventually just got in my car to use the drive thru, as they clearly had no interest in serving me in-person. oddly enough, there were no other cars in line when i pulled in, so i have no idea what the hold up could have been about. once i pulled up to the order area, they promptly took my order, took my money and gave me my food. i am giving them two stars because they worked well in the drive thru, but come on seriously if they can not handle a handful of guests during non-peak hours...

it is. mcdonalds. really? weird people hang out around the drive thru, but so far it has not been...weird?......but yeah. i usually go in the morning, but this locations in a grittier part of la. so i can imagine late at night would be....weirder.....but it is a mcdonalds. so...yeah. a mcdonalds. standard. did i say it was a mcdonalds?

i am writing a review for mcdonald is due to my experience there tonight. ξi usually try my best to avoid this location because of the loiterers. ξthey are not like the usual homeless people at other places and i get skeeved by them. ξi can not really describe..maybe escapees from the loony house or zombies? ξanyway...of course while waiting in line at the drive-thru i see yet another of these loiterers. ξi started cringing and wished i never came here. ξbut when we pulled up to the pick-up window, i noticed that there was a security guard! ξhe stands right by the door and when this loiterer was sneaking back up to the mcd premises, he basically busted out his handcuffs. ξthe loiterer ran off.it is a sad situation, but a relief at a same time to witness tonight is mcd action.

saturday night, 3 am in the morning, em & i drive up to mcd. we patiently make the line. when we finally arrive at the order-speaker-thingy about ten minutes later, we - ordered, and were told to proceed to the window for payment. everything seems pretty normal up to now. make line. order. drive up.30 minutes pass between the time we placed our order and the time we reached the window.we hand them our debit card.- machine not working - what!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!was it so difficult to let us know that the machine was not working when we first placed our order - we had to adjust our order according to the cash we had on us - yes yes, my parents always told me to have cash on me, and we did - but - ugh!!!!!!! grrrrrrrrrrr - that was a forty-five minute waste!!! we could have very simply gone to tb or denny is across the street - aaaaaaaahhhhhhhhhhh - that is how i still feel about this situation!

three cardinal sins:1) the ice cream cones cost twice as much here as other locations around chicago. granted, this means i am paying $1.08 instead of $0.54. some might say it is pointless to critique this - it is just fifty cents! but i say, no! they are charging twice the price. name another thing sold anywhere at a franchise where the price can vary so wildly. also, i hate mcdonald is, and the only reason i go there is because they are losing money by serving me under-priced ice cream cones - they can not possibly profit from this. moreover, c amon, an ice cream cone for fifty cents on hot chicago day? who could pass that up? not even me, a mcdonald is-hating hippie.2) complete chaos at the ordering station, even with very little line.3) pigeons being fed in the outdoor seating area - by an employee - who alternated from cursing at the pigeons to (when they got too close to her) throwing fries to get them to get away. does she not realize that feeding them just keeps those nasty-ass pigeons around?

doing brisk business. "food" ready in less than 10 seconds. unpalatable, ξbut my child got an lps toy, which she was very happy about and exactly three apple slices, which she and baby sister fought for while eschewing the nuggets and fries. good girls!
update. im sick of coming here and having them tell me after a long wait in line that theyre out of whatever im looking for. please. after a few times i get the picture.

stopped in in the early morning hours knowing full well i would need some serious calories for the hours ahead. ξi walked throughout he terrible herbst (th) which this location is connected to. ξno line inside, i was told someone would be with me shortly. i waited, and waited some more. ξi made eye contact with the "white shirt," ξi believe this was the hmfic because they were dressed differently then everyone else. ξthe hmfic failed to smile back. ξi went into hm (hater mode) and walked out. ξi made my purchases at th and punched out. ξi reevaluated my time line for the morning and decided....i needed calories. ξi rolled into the drive-thru and made my purchase quickly and efficiently. ξthe chow was exactly as mcd is does....a-ok.

mcdo notdoit!!!!!wtf!!! ξno way is corporate paying attention to what is going on at this location. ξ11:00 p.m. sunday night, everything for two blocks is closed so i try this mc donald is. ξthree people in line, full staff working the kitchen. ξ10 minutes later i reach the counter to listen to the biggest drama queen bending his managers ear about his boyfriend and getting wasted last night. ξfood took another 15 minutes to come out, 21st century soda dispenser was out of just about everything. ξi am a convert, i will never again eat mcd is. ξi will starve, better for the gray hairs.

they always get my order wrong when i come :(i order a snack wrap with no cheese, add pickles. i got it with cheese and no freaking lettuce on my snack wrap?! ugh. but i never go and complain. :/ whatever is. i blame kitchen people. get it together.

i also live in the neighborhood of this mickey dees..and the only reason i go there is for con-veen-yence..(shut up, you know how to spell it)...otherwise i would never visit this place..everytime i go there, they give me 2 or 3 napkins at the most , and never give me enuff straws for my drinks..i hate gettin' home and having to take the lid off to drink my soda..it never fails..even if i ask them for straws, they are always a drink short! ξbut hey, it is mcdonald is what do u expect?!

i do not know why so much hate for a mcdonald is? i stopped here for a mcchicken since i was ridiculously starving. (it happens to everyone, right?)walked in and in awe of how nice this pace was. large tv sets, glass walls, leather seating that was rather modern and artsy-architectural. went to the cash register and wanted to buy something but it was cash only. like who does that? thank gawd i was with a friend, otherwise i might have rage-quit on them. you do not tell starving people that you are cash only.is a good place to chill and literally a block from my office, so i anticipate coming back -- maybe, if i have cash (seriously though, what the frack?).

this is quite possibly the slowest mcdonald is i have ever been to. ξthere is two drive thru lanes, but all this does it confuse the workers. ξi have placed orders and by the time i reach the cashier she is forgotten it and i am often asked "which order was yours?". ξa few months ago i pulled in around 8am on a sunday. ξi was the only car in the drive thru but no one would answer the speaker. ξfinally i drove around and went in to order. ξi saw all of the employees standing in the back laughing and joking, no one was up at the counter. ξwhen the counter employee finally saw me, she gave a huge sigh and acted like i was bothering her by being there.i have occasionally gone there around 4-5am and am not surprised to be waiting up to ten minutes for food. ξno, that is not an exaggeration, i timed it at a few seconds over 10 minutes last trip (with only two cars ahead of me). ξi know it is a mcd is and i am not expecting a five star dining experience but the wait times can get ridiculous.as far as the food goes, i have not had an awful experiences. ξthey usually get my order right and the food is what you would expect at a mcd is, you are just going to wait an awful long time for it.

so i was at a mc.donald is and i looked down at my mc flurry and i noriced that it did not have enough oreo toppings in it. so i asked the lady if she could add a bit more. she hands it back to me and i see that she just added ice-cream, and my cousin is mcflurry had a lot f cookies and mine did not have almost nothing. i went back and explained to her what had happened. then i turn around and she is back with the manager. im like "why is he here?" we hust left. she sucks as a manager.
